meanings.sent1: The little dool played pranks on his friends.
meanings.sent2: Don't listen to that dool; he's always up to no good.
meanings.sent3: The dool thought it would be funny to hide his friend's shoes.
meanings.sent4: She's a real dool, always causing trouble wherever she goes.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous dool snuck up behind his sister and scared her.

meanings.sent1: Please don't dool around when we need to finish our work.
meanings.sent2: He tends to dool when he's nervous about something.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't help but dool by making silly faces in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The students decided to dool by pretending to be superheroes during recess.
meanings.sent5: Try not to dool too much during the serious meeting.

meanings.definition: To waste time or idle away.
meanings.sent1: Stop dooling and start working on your assignment.
meanings.sent2: He often dools away the hours by daydreaming.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to dool by lazily watching birds from the window.
meanings.sent4: She didn't realize she was dooling the day away until it was dark outside.
meanings.sent5: Don't dool your time away; make the most of every moment.
